data.title: Grand Marais Hiking to 270 Degree Overlook
data.meta_description: Hike MN's North Shore from Grand Maris to 270 Degree Overlook, on the Canadian border. 8 trail sections and 53.5 miles of wilderness trail to explore.
data.text:
Directions

Pincushion Mountain Trailhead in Grand Marais: At Hwy. 61 milepost 110.0, turn left on Cook Co. Rd. 12 (Gunflint Trail) and go 2.0 miles. Turn right on Cook Co. Rd. 53 (Pincushion Drive) and go 0.25 miles to parking lot. Turn from Gunflint Trail has sign marked “Scenic Overlook.” Overnight parking okay, outhouse at trailhead.

NO HIKING ON GROOMED SKI TRAILS IN WINTER! This is a popular skiing location.

Directions

Cook County Road 58 Trailhead: At Hwy. 61 milepost 113.8, turn left on Co. Rd. 58 (Lindskog Rd.) and go 0.8 miles to trailhead parking lot on left. Overnight parking okay.

Alternate Parking Option: Cook Co. Rd. 14 parking lot. At Hwy. 61 milepost 117.6, turn left and go 0.7 miles to parking lot. Overnight parking okay.

Directions

Judge Magney State Park: At Hwy. 61 milepost 123.8, turn left into entrance for state park. Continue straight on service road to large parking lot. State park sticker required for entry to state park. Overnight parking okay. Purchase annual sticker at another park. Single or several day use permit can be purchased via self-registration and payment onsite. Outhouse, drinking water, picnic tables at trailhead.

Alternate parking for this section: At Hwy. 61 milepost 124.4, turn left (north) on Cook Co. Rd. 69 (North Rd.) and go 2.75 miles. Turn left (north) on Cook Co. Rd. 70 (Camp 20 Rd.) and go 3.0 miles to parking lot on left. Parking for day use only.

Directions

County Road 70 Trailhead: At Hwy. 61 milepost 124.4, turn left (north) on Cook Co. Rd. 69 (North Rd.) and go 2.75 miles. Turn left (north) on Cook Co. Rd. 70 (Camp 20 Rd.) and go 4.75 miles to trailhead parking lot on right (about 0.25 miles past Hong Hill Rd.). Room for six cars only – absolutely no parking on road outside of parking lot since big logging trucks frequently use this narrow road. Overnight parking okay.

Directions

Jackson Lake Road Trailhead: At Hwy. 61 milepost 128.9 turn left and go 4.5 miles on Co. Rd. 16 (Arrowhead Trail). Turn right on Jackson Lake Rd. and go 3.1 miles to trailhead parking lot on left. Overnight parking okay.

Directions

Otter Lake Road Trailhead: At Hwy. 61 milepost 128.9, turn left and go 4.5 miles on Co. Rd. 16 (Arrowhead Trail). Turn right on Jackson Lake Rd and go 8.4 miles. Turn left on Otter Lake Rd. at Otter Lake Rd./Rengo Rd. “T” intersection and go 2.0 miles to trailhead parking lot on left. Overnight parking okay.
